chunks.zh: 炒股有什么需要注意的
chunks.en: What should I pay attention to when investing in stocks?

chunks.zh: 听了昨天 V 友的推荐开了户准备小玩下，看是否能转移注意力缓解情绪...
chunks.en: I opened an account based on a recommendation from a V2EX user yesterday and plan to play around a bit to see if it can distract me and relieve my emotions...

chunks.zh: 注意留 3k 购买电动车
chunks.en: Be sure to keep 3k for buying an electric scooter.

chunks.zh: 既然来问了，我就不劝你不开户了
chunks.en: Since you're asking, I won't advise you against opening an account.

chunks.zh: 我这几年从亏 50% 到现在平均年化不到 15%的一点小经验
chunks.en: Here's a little experience from my past few years, going from losing 50% to now averaging less than 15% annually:

chunks.zh: 别短线，买入一支股票的时候要做好止盈止损的计划，并且严格按照计划执行
chunks.en: Don't day trade. When buying a stock, have a take-profit and stop-loss plan in place and strictly follow it.

chunks.zh: 不懂的东西不碰，宁可空仓也不要追涨
chunks.en: Don't touch things you don't understand. It's better to be out of the market than to chase the highs.

chunks.zh: 买在无人问津时，卖在人声鼎沸时
chunks.en: Buy when no one cares and sell when everyone is excited.

chunks.zh: 不挣最后一个铜板
chunks.en: Don't try to make the last cent.

chunks.zh: 其实都是很简单的道理，执行起来很难
chunks.en: These are all simple principles, but they are difficult to execute.

chunks.zh: 注意: 不要炒股
chunks.en: Note: Don't invest in stocks.

chunks.zh: 注意进厂时机
chunks.en: Pay attention to the timing of entering the factory (i.e., getting a job).

chunks.zh: 这个 v 友跟你有杀父之仇吗 推荐你炒股
chunks.en: Does this V2EX user have a grudge against you? Recommending you to invest in stocks?

chunks.zh: 笑死, 看了一下 V 友明显在开玩笑.
chunks.en: LOL, I looked at it and the V2EX user was clearly joking.

chunks.zh: 按照你容易上头的特点, 如果在大 A 开户,  你之后可能还容易上天台 https://v2ex.com/t/1110181#r_15881906
chunks.en: Given your tendency to get carried away, if you open an account in the A-share market, you might end up on the roof afterward. https://v2ex.com/t/1110181#r_15881906

chunks.zh: 建议直接投美股或者港股，港股买银行的，美股定投标普 500 和纳斯达克 100
chunks.en: I suggest investing directly in US stocks or Hong Kong stocks. Buy bank stocks in Hong Kong and dollar-cost average into the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 in the US.

chunks.zh: 如果开的 a 股账户，尽量买这些对应的场内基金，个股少碰，新手很容易拿不住，受情绪跟风影响比较多
chunks.en: If you open an A-share account, try to buy the corresponding ETFs. Avoid individual stocks. It's easy for novices to lose their grip and be influenced by emotions and trends.

chunks.zh: 听我的，满仓黄金，想风险小点就黄金 ETF ，五年后财产翻三倍
chunks.en: Listen to me, go all-in on gold. If you want less risk, buy gold ETFs. Your assets will triple in five years.

chunks.zh: 劝人炒股 天打雷劈
chunks.en: Advising someone to invest in stocks is like being struck by lightning.

chunks.zh: 如果一定要进 请千万做好预期管理 拉好风控线 不 allin 不抄底 不上杠杆 尽量不持有个股 一点一点进 不要按天炒股 买了就别老看盘
chunks.en: If you must enter, please be sure to manage your expectations, set up risk control lines, don't go all-in, don't buy the dip, don't use leverage, try not to hold individual stocks, enter little by little, don't day trade, and don't keep watching the market after you buy.

chunks.zh: 注意不要炒股
chunks.en: Note: Don't invest in stocks.

chunks.zh: 不怕你赚钱，就怕你不玩
chunks.en: I'm not afraid of you making money, I'm afraid of you not playing (the game).

chunks.zh: @bjfane 保留 3k 还有后路，买电动车美团饿了么送外卖以图东山再起
chunks.en: @bjfane Keeping 3k leaves you a way out. Buy an electric scooter and deliver food for Meituan or Ele.me to make a comeback.

chunks.zh: 快逃
chunks.en: Run away!

chunks.zh: 留几百块吃饭
chunks.en: Keep a few hundred yuan for food.

chunks.zh: 入市有风险，投资需谨慎
chunks.en: There are risks in the market, invest with caution.

chunks.zh: 去正规市场
chunks.en: Go to a regulated market.

chunks.zh: 什么情况也不要买 A 股
chunks.en: Don't buy A-shares under any circumstances.

chunks.zh: 情绪不稳的不要债基以上投资
chunks.en: If you are emotionally unstable, don't invest in anything beyond bond funds.

chunks.zh: 建议销户
chunks.en: I suggest closing the account.

chunks.zh: 模拟 炒一年（上点心学习透），上手一年（交一年学费），准备挣钱（不一定能挣到，看方法了）
chunks.en: Simulate trading for a year (study it thoroughly), then trade live for a year (pay your tuition), then prepare to make money (not guaranteed, depends on your method).

chunks.zh: 想想赌场，转移注意力是可以的，缓解情绪是不能的，只会增加情绪波动。
chunks.en: Think of a casino. Distracting yourself is possible, but relieving emotions is not. It will only increase emotional fluctuations.
